net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component

Interface TableCellEditor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BooleanValueEditor, Calendar, Checkbox, ComboBox, DoubleEntryField, Field, LocalizedObjectKeyFieldComponent, SearchableComboBox

    public interface TableCellEditor

    Defines an interface for objects that can edit table cells.

    The idea of a renderer is that the component is used as a "rubber stamp" when the cell is drawn. The same component may be used for several cells, and really should be for best performance. Note that the component is discarded after the cell is drawn, so no state is persisted. Properties such as selection state or user entered data may not be updated in the component(s) as generally the table model is updated directly.

    NOTE: The component returned from the cell editor method will be referenced using a weak reference. You must hold a strong reference for as long as you need the component. It is recommended to hold the reference as a field in the cell editor implementation. (Components that implement this interface directly will work fine as the cell editor is held as a strong reference).

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Component getTableCellEditorComponent(Table table, java.lang.Object value, boolean isSelected, int row, int column)
      Returns a Component to use for editing a cell in a table.

    • Method Detail

      • getTableCellEditorComponent

        Component getTableCellEditorComponent(Table table,
                                      java.lang.Object value,
                                      boolean isSelected,
                                      int row,
                                      int column)

        Returns a Component to use for editing a cell in a table.

        Note to implementers of this interface: If you write a class that implements this interface and returns another TableCellEditor capable Component, be sure to call the other Component's getTableCellEditorComponent() method.

        Parameters:
        table - The Table that has the data being edited.
        value - The value of the cell being edited.
        isSelected - Indicates whether the cell is in a selected state.
        row - The row for the cell.
        column - The column model index (NOT the model index!).
        Returns:
        An object that is a Component which can be used to edit the value stored in the specified table cell.
